questions.title: Reporting column alignment
questions.description: In reporting, aligning column names without any spacing means that the text within each column header is positioned directly next to one another, with no extra space between them. This alignment can help in creating a cleaner and more compact layout

questions.title: Holiday functionality in class details
questions.description: We can add holiday functionality in the class details to streamline the process of adjusting calendar topics after holidays. Currently, manually transferring each agenda item to the next working day can be cumbersome, especially when clients provide holidays. By allowing users to mark holidays in the calendar, all upcoming topics and agenda items will automatically shift to the next working day, reducing the workload and minimizing errors. This feature would provide a more organized and efficient way to manage class schedules during holidays.

questions.title: Site column in Class List interface
questions.description: As a user, I want to have a site column next to the country column on the Class List interface of the landing page so that I can easily identify and manage classes by both their country and site locations. This will enhance my ability to organize and access class information more efficiently.

questions.title: EverGrade regional report
questions.description: The objective is to develop a report based on the data registered in EverGrade for active users. The report should group by regions (NAC, LATAM, IND) and provide detailed information about active users, classes, enrolled agents, graduated agents, as well as completed and rescheduled students. Report Details: General Data (By Region): NAC, LATAM, IND. Fields: Total of active users, Classes, Enrolled agents, Graduated agents, Completed students, Rescheduled students. Grouping by Regions: The report should group by regions (NAC, LATAM, IND). Detailed Information: For each region, it should include general data and data grouped by months and years. Output Format: The report should be exportable in Excel or PDF format. User Interface: The tool should have an intuitive interface to select regions and generate the report. Data Validation: Validate that the entered data is correct and consistent.

questions.title: Show exceptions as 'NA' in reports
questions.description: As a user, I want exceptions to be reflected as "NA" instead of showing as 0 or Nil in the Class Graduation Report and in other reports where the Observation Form and Audit Form are a part of the report. This will provide a clearer indication of missing data without causing confusion.

questions.title: FST stage dates in Graduation Report
questions.description: As a user, I want the FST stage start and end date columns to be added to the Graduation Report so that I can track and monitor the progress of learners through the FST stages more effectively. This will provide valuable insights into the timing and duration of these stages, helping me to better manage learner progression.

questions.title: Site-based report filtering
questions.description: As a User, I want to be able to filter reports based on the site where the data was collected, so that I can generate site-specific reports efficiently and accurately.

questions.title: Attrition Report headcount correction
questions.description: As a User, I need a feature that updates the Attrition Report to reflect the correct headcount numbers. Specifically, I require the removal of the effect of rescheduled learners who have successfully enrolled in a new class to be counted as fallout, and ensure these learners are included in the updated start headcount. Additionally, I need the Stage details information in the CSR report to be corrected, as the current logic for calculating the start headcount in stages is incorrect. This update will help us maintain accurate records and provide better insights into our employee attrition and enrollment trends.

questions.title: Associate Evaluation Form grace period
questions.description: I want to ensure that evaluators have an additional three grace days to complete the scores for specified stages. If an evaluator does not complete the evaluation within the specified time frame, including the grace period, the corresponding score fields should be grayed out. A request exclusion button should be visible to the Learning Specialist in the module. Upon clicking this button, a pop-up should appear with fields for "Exclusion Reason" and "Comment," allowing the Learning Specialist to submit a request for unlocking the blocked form. This request should go through an approval process in the approvals section via the admin. Once approved, the grayed-out evaluation fields should become visible again, and the evaluation form should be labeled as "late evaluation." The late evaluation remark and the last update date should be clearly visible in the raw report. This will help maintain transparency and fairness in the evaluation process while providing flexibility for evaluators who may face unforeseen circumstances.
